metadata.Title: CVE-2020-28915 on Ubuntu 23.10 (mantic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A buffer over-read (at the framebuffer layer) in the fbcon code in the Linux kernel before 5.8.15 could be used by local attackers to read kernel memory, aka CID-6735b4632def. It was discovered that the framebuffer implementation in the Linux kernel did not properly perform range checks in certain situations. A local attacker could use this to expose sensitive information (kernel memory).

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-28915` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-6.5.0-10-generic - 5.15.0-25.25
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-10-generic - 5.15.0-25.25
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-10-generic-64k - 5.15.0-25.25
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1009-aws - 5.15.0-1004.6
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1008-azure - 5.15.0-1003.4
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1008-gcp - 5.15.0-1003.6
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1009-ibm - 5.15.0-1002.2
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-10-lowlatency - 5.15.0-24.24

No subscription required

No subscription required

No subscription required

notes.Note: sbeattie> This patch depends on patch "fbdev, newport_con: Move FONT_EXTRA_WORDS macros into linux/font.h".
